v.v: The words of King Lemuel—an instruction his mother taught him.
What, my son? What is it, son of my womb?
Do not give your strength to women,
It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine,
because when they drink they forget what has been decreed,
Give strong drink to a person who is perishing
He will drink and he will forget his poverty
Speak for those who cannot speak,
Speak out and judge by the measure of what is right
Who can find a capable wife?
The heart of her husband trusts in her,
She does good things for him and not evil
She selects wool and flax,
She is like the merchant ships;
She rises while it is night
She considers a field and buys it,
She dresses herself with strength
She perceives what will make a good profit for her;
She puts her hands on the spindle,
She reaches out with her hand to poor people;
She is not afraid of the snow for her household,
She makes coverings for her bed,
Her husband is known at the gates,
She makes linen garments and sells them,
She is clothed with strength and honor,
She opens her mouth with wisdom
She watches over the ways of her household
Her children rise up and call her blessed,
“Many women have done well,
Elegance is deceptive, beauty is vain,
Give her the fruit of her hands

v: What do you want, son of my vows?
or your ways to those who destroy kings.
or for rulers to crave strong drink,
and pervert the rights of all the afflicted.
and wine to those in bitter distress.
and he will not remember his trouble.
for the causes of all who are perishing.
and plead the cause of poor and needy people.
Her value is far more than jewels.
and he will never be poor.
all the days of her life.
and works with the delight of her hands.
she brings her food from far away.
and gives food to her household,
and she distributes the work for her female servants.
with the fruit of her hands she plants a vineyard.
and makes her arms strong.
all night long her lamp is not extinguished.
and she holds the twisting thread.
she reaches out with her hands to needy people.
for all her household are clothed in scarlet.
and she wears clothes of fine purple linen.
when he sits with the elders of the land.
and she supplies sashes to the merchants.
and she laughs at the time to come.
and the law of kindness is on her tongue.
and does not eat the bread of idleness.
and her husband praises her, saying,
but you surpassed them all.”
but a woman who fears Yahweh, she will be praised.
and let her works praise her in the gates.
